body:
If i kick someone's content from one of my guilds i can subsequently yank it from general onto a private sub where nobody will be able to comment.

This is not a lot of effort required to be a dick if i'm an asshole GM.

Test thread in question: https://ruqqus.com/post/ey9/post

And it has been fixed in a timely manned by CaptainMeta.

post.title: So, mod abuse is still possible.

body:
Do you mean to duplicate the post as in:

- Post is cloned, and comments added in +general will not be visible in the private guild and vice versa, or
- Post is cross-posted, and is now visible in the private guild AND +general, and any comments added in either are visible in both

I think cloning it is undesirable as you would get a branching conversation. Also, what should happen to comments made by people who don't have access to the private guild? Would they still be visible on their profiles despite the user not being able to access them anymore? Obviously, they should not be made invisible for the user.

I'm not sure if cross-posting is the right idea either, it might make it look like people commenting from +general have access to the private guild, which they don't.

I think it may be better to prevent yanking to private guilds entirely.
body_html:
Do you mean to duplicate the post as in:

  • Post is cloned, and comments added in +general will not be visible in the private guild and vice versa, or
  • Post is cross-posted, and is now visible in the private guild AND +general, and any comments added in either are visible in both

I think cloning it is undesirable as you would get a branching conversation. Also, what should happen to comments made by people who don't have access to the private guild? Would they still be visible on their profiles despite the user not being able to access them anymore? Obviously, they should not be made invisible for the user.

I'm not sure if cross-posting is the right idea either, it might make it look like people commenting from +general have access to the private guild, which they don't.

I think it may be better to prevent yanking to private guilds entirely.

body:
Yeah that could cause some issues 

The other thing that could happen is someone could yank it to a public guild and then just set the guild private, to get around your last hypothetical.

Maybe a simpler way would be to make any yanked posts stay public regardless of where they are, although not sure if possible code wise, maybe that wouldn't work with the way guilds work.
body_html:
Yeah that could cause some issues

body:
Mod abuse will always be possible.

I don't think the problem with Reddit is the fact mods are so abusive of their position. The problem with reddit is that there is no accountability for moderators. They're allowed to be petty despots with no consequences, and often the admins who are meant to hold them accountable appear complicit.
body_html:
Mod abuse will always be possible.

I don't think the problem with Reddit is the fact mods are so abusive of their position. The problem with reddit is that there is no accountability for moderators. They're allowed to be petty despots with no consequences, and often the admins who are meant to hold them accountable appear complicit.

post.body:
If i kick someone's content from one of my guilds i can subsequently yank it from general onto a private sub where nobody will be able to comment.

This is not a lot of effort required to be a dick if i'm an asshole GM.

Test thread in question: https://ruqqus.com/post/ey9/post

And it has been fixed in a timely manned by CaptainMeta.

body: I agree with this. A post's visibility status shouldn't change at all. On that note, should private posts end up in +general?
body_html: I agree with this. A post's visibility status shouldn't change at all. On that note, should private posts end up in +general?

guild.name: DumpsterFire

parent.body:
Do you mean to duplicate the post as in:

- Post is cloned, and comments added in +general will not be visible in the private guild and vice versa, or
- Post is cross-posted, and is now visible in the private guild AND +general, and any comments added in either are visible in both

I think cloning it is undesirable as you would get a branching conversation. Also, what should happen to comments made by people who don't have access to the private guild? Would they still be visible on their profiles despite the user not being able to access them anymore? Obviously, they should not be made invisible for the user.

I'm not sure if cross-posting is the right idea either, it might make it look like people commenting from +general have access to the private guild, which they don't.

I think it may be better to prevent yanking to private guilds entirely.
parent.body_html:
Do you mean to duplicate the post as in:

  • Post is cloned, and comments added in +general will not be visible in the private guild and vice versa, or
  • Post is cross-posted, and is now visible in the private guild AND +general, and any comments added in either are visible in both

I think cloning it is undesirable as you would get a branching conversation. Also, what should happen to comments made by people who don't have access to the private guild? Would they still be visible on their profiles despite the user not being able to access them anymore? Obviously, they should not be made invisible for the user.

I'm not sure if cross-posting is the right idea either, it might make it look like people commenting from +general have access to the private guild, which they don't.

I think it may be better to prevent yanking to private guilds entirely.
